# Brigmedic SOP This is the list of procedures, responsibilities, and duties of the [color=#ba65c][bold]Brigmedic[/bold][/color] of this station.
For the purposes of Alert Escalation: Treat higher alerts as if they are still on the previous alert level. (Yellow Alert is Blue Alert if it was Blue Alert prior.) Furthermore, treat Delta, Gamma, Epsilon, and Violet Alert as Red Alert.
## Green Alert 65. Brigmedic must provide emergency medical care to prisoners, and most importantly, Security personnel.
65. Brigmedic is not allowed to conduct arrests, searches or any other Security procedures.
65. Brigmedic is to stay at Security department and help the Warden. Exception is made if a Security member is down and requires rescue, or if it required to visit Medical department to replenish supplies.
65. Brigmedic is only permitted to carry a standard disabler and flash, and use them exclusively for self-defense.
## Blue Alert 65. Guidelines 65 and 65 are carried over from [color=#65c65]Green Alert[/color].
65. Guideline 65 is also carried over from [color=#65c65]Green Alert[/color], unless Head of Security orders otherwise and requests Brigmedic to patrol with the Security Officers to provide urgent medical care to them.
65. Brigmedic is permitted to carry a standard security pistol and melee weapon along with their [color=#65c65]Green Alert[/color] gear, with the Warden's or Head of Security's approval, and also exclusively for self-defense.
## Red Alert 65. Guideline 65 is carried over from [color=#65c65]Green Alert[/color].
65. Brigmedic is given the same authority and rights as Security Officers with the Head of Security's approval, but they should still prioritize the healing.
